title: createStudy
text: createStudy() starting point building study project OMOP Common Data Model (CDM) using OmopStudyBuilder package. generates fully structured project folder containing: Templates study diagnostics Templates analysis code Shiny apps diagnostics reporting project README reproducible, opinionated layout aligned OxInfer conventions allows immediately focus writing study-specific code instead manually assembling surrounding infrastructure. vignette learn : Create new study project using createStudy() Explore folder structure generated Control whether diagnostics /study analysis templates included Understand next steps project creation

title: createStudy
text: simplest way use createStudy() provide directory path. directory: exist: created Exists empty: used Exists contains files: error thrown avoid modifying real project directories, vignette uses temporary folder. see something like: diagnostics_code/ – diagnostic scripts helpers diagnostics_shiny/ – skeleton diagnostics Shiny app study_code/ – scripts running main analyses study_shiny/ – skeleton reporting Shiny app README.md – overview study project inspect full structure:
code: # Create a temporary root for this vignette study_root <- file.path(tempdir(), "SampleStudy")  createStudy(study_root)  # Show top-level contents created by createStudy() list.files(study_root) #> [1] "diagnostics_code"  "diagnostics_shiny" "README.md"         #> [4] "study_code"        "study_shiny" list.files(study_root, recursive = TRUE) #>  [1] "diagnostics_code/code_to_run.R"                 #>  [2] "diagnostics_code/cohorts/instantiate_cohorts.R" #>  [3] "diagnostics_code/README.md"                     #>  [4] "diagnostics_code/results/readme.md"             #>  [5] "diagnostics_code/run_study.R"                   #>  [6] "diagnostics_shiny/README.md"                    #>  [7] "README.md"                                      #>  [8] "study_code/analyses/cohort_characteristics.R"   #>  [9] "study_code/analyses/cohort_survival.R"          #> [10] "study_code/analyses/drug_utilisation.R"         #> [11] "study_code/analyses/incidence_prevalence.R"     #> [12] "study_code/code_to_run.R"                       #> [13] "study_code/codelist/codelist_creation.R"        #> [14] "study_code/cohorts/instantiate_cohorts.R"       #> [15] "study_code/Dockerfile"                          #> [16] "study_code/README.md"                           #> [17] "study_code/Results/README.md"                   #> [18] "study_code/run_study.R"                         #> [19] "study_shiny/README.md"

title: createStudy
text: can control parts template created diagnostics study arguments.

title: createStudy
code: diag_root <- file.path(tempdir(), "DiagnosticsOnly")  createStudy(   directory   = diag_root,   diagnostics = TRUE,   study       = FALSE )  list.files(diag_root) #> [1] "diagnostics_code"  "diagnostics_shiny" "README.md"

title: createStudy
code: study_only_root <- file.path(tempdir(), "StudyOnly")  createStudy(   directory   = study_only_root,   diagnostics = FALSE,   study       = TRUE )  list.files(study_only_root) #> [1] "README.md"   "study_code"  "study_shiny"

title: createStudy
text: generating project structure, mainly work folders files: StudyCode.Rproj: open RStudio work main analysis code. sets working directory relative paths behave correctly. code_to_run.R: add database connection details, schemas, global settings cohorts/instantiate_cohorts.R: defines study cohorts using codelists cohort-building functions. customise match phenotype definitions. run_study.R: orchestrates analysis steps (cohort creation, summaries, analyses, export). diagnostics.Rproj: open project work diagnostics. keeps diagnostics code separate main analysis project. code_to_run.R: similar study version, dedicated diagnostics. set connection details schemas used running phenotype diagnostics. cohorts/instantiate_cohorts.R: defines cohorts diagnostic checking, often mirroring simplifying main study cohorts. run_study.R: runs PhenotypeDiagnostics workflow exports diagnostic results. might tweak options, overall flow usually left intact. shiny app explore study results. extend plots, tables, filters built top exported outputs. Contains minimal Shiny app exploring diagnostic outputs. Use review cohort characteristics diagnostic results interactively across data partners.

title: createStudy
text: study code ready, OmopStudyBuilder provides functions package Docker image distribute data partners.

title: createStudy
text: image contains: - exact R version - package dependencies (renv.lock) - study code - Database drivers system dependencies
code: # Build a Docker image containing your study code buildStudy(   image_name = "omop-study-study-code",   path = file.path(study_root, "study_code") ) #> Building Docker image: omop-study-study-code #> This may take some minutes on first build... #> ✔ Image built successfully: omop-study-study-code

previous_headings: Building and Distributing Your Study > Distribution Options
title: createStudy
text: Push Docker Hub easy sharing connected partners: Data partners can pull run image. can run either interactive RStudio Server session, run study automated mode.
code: pushStudyImage(   image_name = "omop-study-study-code",   repo = "yourusername/myomopstudy" ) #> ✔ Image pushed to Docker Hub! library(OmopStudyBuilder)  # Interactive (requires image built with buildStudy(useRStudio = TRUE)): runRStudio(   image_name = "yourusername/myomopstudy:latest",   results_path = "./results" )

title: createStudy
text: RStudio Server runs Docker image opens browser RStudio Server URL: Partners edit credentials code_to_run.R run study interactively. Automated execution (programmatic workflows): stop running OmopStudyBuilder containers, use: operational details, see README files generated study folders (example study_code/README.md diagnostics_code/README.md).
code: # Requires image built with buildStudy(useRStudio = TRUE) runRStudio(   image_name = "omop-study-study-code",   results_path = "./results" ) runStudy(   image_name = "omop-study-study-code",   results_path = "./results",   data_path = "path/to/data" ) stopStudy(image_name = "omop-study-study-code")

title: dockerWrapper
text: vignette describes Docker helper functions OmopStudyBuilder: buildStudy() builds Docker image study runRStudio() starts interactive RStudio Server session inside image runStudy() runs study script automated mode (streaming logs) stopStudy() stops containers started runRStudio()/runStudy() pushStudyImage() tags pushes image Docker Hub Docker calls require Docker installed Docker daemon running.

title: dockerWrapper
text: buildStudy() expects renv.lock (renv activation files) directory point . default also snapshot dependencies building. want runRStudio(), build RStudio base image: renv.lock includes GitHub packages hit GitHub rate limits build, pass token:
code: # From the study_code folder (or pass path=...) buildStudy(   image_name = "my-study",   path = "./study_code",   useRStudio = FALSE ) buildStudy(   image_name = "my-study",   path = "./study_code",   useRStudio = TRUE ) buildStudy(   path = "./study_code",   github_token = Sys.getenv("GITHUB_PAT") )

title: dockerWrapper
text: runRStudio() runs Docker image opens browser RStudio Server URL. Results written results_path host. pass runtime settings container, create .env file working directory used automatically (provide env_file = "path//.env").

title: dockerWrapper
text: runStudy() executes R script container (default code_to_run.R) streams stdout/stderr console.

title: dockerWrapper
text: Use stopStudy() stop containers started runRStudio() /runStudy().

title: dockerWrapper
text: pushStudyImage() tag image_name:latest push Docker Hub repository.

title: reviewStudy
text: receive study package (ship one), useful quickly inspect: files included (R scripts, JSON, CSV, Excel) Whether renv.lock exists, contains Whether dependencies look surprising study type OmopStudyBuilder provides two helpers: reviewStudyCode() summarises contents directory reviewStudyDependencies() summarises dependencies based renv.lock

what: Review files in a study folder
title: reviewStudy
text: Point reviewStudyCode() folder want inspect (often study_code/ diagnostics_code/). simplest pattern run commands within project want review (example, open StudyCode.Rproj Diagnostics.Rproj).

title: reviewStudy
text: reviewStudyDependencies() expects renv.lock file directory. Use type = "analysis" analysis code, type = "reporting" reporting code.

title: Authors and Citation
text: package maintainer. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ww (2026). OmopStudyBuilder: Package (Title Case). R package version 0.1.0, https://oxford-pharmacoepi.github.io/OmopStudyBuilder/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {OmopStudyBuilder: What the Package Does (Title Case)},   author = {Who wrote it},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://oxford-pharmacoepi.github.io/OmopStudyBuilder/}, }

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: OmopStudyBuilder package helps study prepare network studies using OMOP Common Data Model (CDM). package sets R project study default folder structure template code typically required network studies. allows focus parts analysis specific study design. addition project setup, package reviews code dependencies, supports renv locking consistent package versions, can build run Docker image reproducible execution aligned best practices. package highly opinionated designed align OxInfer study code checklist. details, please refer documentation.

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: can install development version package GitHub:

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: package supports building running study code Docker reproducible execution. Install Docker confirm running using Docker-based workflow. General checks (operating systems) Install Docker. Start Docker (e.g., Docker Desktop). docker --version docker info macOS Install Docker Desktop Mac: https://docs.docker.com/desktop/setup/install/mac-install/ Open Docker Desktop wait reports “Docker Desktop running”. Windows Install Docker Desktop Windows (WSL 2 recommended): https://docs.docker.com/desktop/setup/install/windows-install/ Ensure WSL 2 enabled (Docker Desktop installer guide ). Open Docker Desktop wait running. Linux Install Docker Engine using distribution instructions: https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/ Start/enable Docker service (varies distro). want run Docker without sudo, follow: https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/linux-postinstall/

title: What the Package Does (Title Case)
text: illustrate OmopStudyBuilder works, start creating study folder reviewing contains: Lock package versions renv everyone runs environment, build study image study folder. Run study interactively RStudio Server automated script. use .env file credentials, pass env_file = ".env". Use optional inputs need : distribute study, share study folder created createStudy() (including study_code/ renv.lock). Partners can build run using commands. push built image Docker Hub, use helper enter credentials prompted (tag defaults latest, image name defaults current folder name):
code: library(OmopStudyBuilder) createStudy(here::here("SampleStudy"))  reviewStudyCode(here::here("SampleStudy", "study_code")) reviewStudyDependencies(here::here("SampleStudy", "study_code")) renv::init(here::here("SampleStudy", "study_code")) install.packages(c("dplyr", "CDMConnector", "IncidencePrevalence")) renv::snapshot(here::here("SampleStudy", "study_code"))  buildStudy(path = here::here("SampleStudy", "study_code")) runRStudio() runStudy() runStudy(   image_name = "omop-study-study-code",   data_path = "path/to/data",   results_path = "./results" ) install.packages("OmopStudyBuilder") library(OmopStudyBuilder)  buildStudy(path = here::here("SampleStudy", "study_code")) runStudy() runRStudio() stopStudy() pushStudyImage(   repo = "yourname/omop-study-study-code" )

text: image_name Name Docker image (default: auto-detected directory) path Path study directory (default: current directory) useRStudio Use RStudio Server base (TRUE) r-ver base (FALSE, default) r_version R version override (default: auto-detected renv.lock) snapshot Update renv.lock building (default: TRUE) github_token Optional GitHub token installing GitHub packages build

title: Creates initial directory for an OMOP CDM network study — createStudy
Creates initial directory for an OMOP CDM network study — createStudy
text: directory Path directory used root folder study. exist, created. directory must empty already exists. diagnostics single TRUE FALSE value. TRUE (default), function creates `diagnostics_code/` `diagnostics_shiny/` folders using package templates. FALSE, diagnostics folders created. study single TRUE FALSE value. TRUE (default), function creates `study_code/` `study_shiny/` folders using package templates. FALSE, study folders created.

title: Creates initial directory for an OMOP CDM network study — createStudy
text: Project directory created

title: Creates initial directory for an OMOP CDM network study — createStudy
code: # Create a study called "SampleStudy" in a temporary directory study_root <- file.path(tempdir(), "SampleStudy") createStudy(study_root) #> ✔ /tmp/RtmppJIwAi/SampleStudy prepared as root folder for study. #> ✔ /tmp/RtmppJIwAi/SampleStudy/diagnostics_code prepared for study diagnostics code #> ✔ /tmp/RtmppJIwAi/SampleStudy/diagnostics_shiny prepared for diagnostics shiny app #> ✔ /tmp/RtmppJIwAi/SampleStudy/study_code prepared for study study code #> ✔ /tmp/RtmppJIwAi/SampleStudy/study_shiny prepared for study shiny app  # Inspect the top-level contents list.files(study_root) #> [1] "README.md"         "diagnostics_code"  "diagnostics_shiny" #> [4] "study_code"        "study_shiny"
